item.title: iggy: ignore file processor for jvm
item.description: As a core team member for Swagger Codegen, one of the major features I’ve added in the last year was support for .

item.title: Prototyping a Flags/Bitmasks implementation in Kotlin 1.1.1
item.description: One of my more favorite features of C# is the use of FlagsAttribute. If you’re not familiar with the concept, [Flags] allows you to treat an integral enum type as a bitmask.

item.title: Decorating directives with isolate scope in Angular 1.3
item.description: A question from reddit excited my interest. Angular 1.3 apparently has broken the ability to decorate isolate scopes. I tried version of Angular between the 1.

item.title: Release: New Tab Redirect 3.0
item.description: On Wednesday, I began the rollout of New Tab Redirect 3.0 with some bug fixes and a huge new feature: a built in ‘Apps’ page.

item.title: Google Chrome Extension: New Tab Redirect! STEP BY STEP
item.description: If you’ve reached this this page in an attempt to find instructions for uninstalling the extension here they are: Navigate to chrome://extensions Click ‘Uninstall’ below ‘New Tab Redirect!

item.title: Python 3.0 handles Dictionary differently
item.description: I read through Python 3.0 from Developer’s Library about 2 months ago. I decided to skim through another introductory level book used at MIT so I could try keeping Python 2.

item.title: Ruby and Python in your script tags!
item.description: I came across this weeks ago, and I’m surprised I never posted it. This is a javascript ‘framework’ to add ruby and python languages in your script tags.

item.title: Keeping busy with ASP.NET MVC
item.description: I’m looking for a job in “the worst recession since the great depression” blah blah blah. It really sucks. To keep busy, I’ve been doing some ‘freelance’ work.

item.title: Quake Tracker using Google Maps API v3 and XML/Atom feed

item.title: JavaScript & CSS Modal Loading DIV
item.description: Things I’ve used in this: Prototype Javascript (http://prototypejs.org/) Loading image (http://www.ajaxload.info/) Script & CSS What I do here is build a DIV element and show it on the page while Prototype’s Ajax Request object is loading.

item.title: Storing Generics in ASP.NET Profile object
item.description: Sometimes, I’ll come across a problem that I research for an hour or two. When I find the solution, I think “Wow, that should have been the first thing I tried!

item.title: Displaying multiple fields in a Dropdownlist’s DataTextField
item.description: I’ve encountered this problem on occasion, where I want to display more than one field in a dropdownlist’s DataTextField property. In the past, I’ve overcome this problem by rewriting a SQL statement, or adding another column in the database itself to accomodate my needs.

item.title: T-SQL Multi-Table Delete
item.description: I was trying to run a DELETE query on multiple tables and I kept getting this error: The DELETE statement conflicted with the REFERENCE constraint I’m not that great with SQL, but I can get by.

item.title: LINQ: more like "Luckily I Never Quit"
item.description: I’ve been using LINQ quite a bit lately. As the blog title says: luckily, I never quit. There are a lot of things to get used to with LINQ.

item.title: C++ Templated QuickSort Algorithm
item.description: It has been over a month since I posted. I’ve been really busy with all of my classes. So, instead of going too in depth with anything, I’m just going to share some code we’ve written.

item.title: C# Insertion Sorting algorithm
item.description: Here is a console application to test an Insertion Sorting algorithm adapted from chapter 2 of MIT’s Introduction to Algorithms. I thought this might come in handy for any beginners, as well as a fun way to test your computer’s performance.

item.title: Silverlight 2.0, broken XAML Intellisense fix
item.description: I installed all the necessary files for Silverlight today. When I created a project, the xaml document didn’t have intellisense and opened as a text instead of XML-based document.
